description.narrative:
'Background: Signing labour contracts is the right of the employee and the obligation of the employer. In fact, this has not been fully implemented. A preliminary study in Ba Vi District among 04 groups of women, the poor, ethnic minorities, and working-aged women found that respondents were not fully aware of the right and importance of signing employment contracts.
Objectives: This initiative aims to promote the practice of signing labour contracts through building awareness and providing legal consultancy. It will target 5000 beneficiaries belonging to 4 abovementioned groups in Ba Vi District, Hanoi City. In particular:
- Enhancing perception and understanding about the right to signing labour contracts for a core group of 750 people, including approximately 150 females. - Providing legal consultancy and assistance, and legal representation on issues related to the right to signing labour contracts, disputes during the implementation of labour contracts, as well as other issues related tolabour and employment for about 4,000 - 4,500 people. - Legal Advice for Poor people and Community Development Center with 16 years of experience in community-based communication and legal consultancy will implement this initiative in the best, most effective way.

participating-org.narrative: '- Since its establishment in 2004 (re-registered under 2008 Decree 77 on Legal Consultancy), the Center has been operating and notviolating the law during its operation. The Center has accomplished legal consultancy and communication for thousands of people whovisit our office. Our beneficiaries are among women, the poor, families under preferential treatment policy, people in minor ethniccommunities and remote areas, the homeless elderly, the vulnerable ... - Within 10 consecutive years from 2008- 2018, the Center has implemented 3 phases of the project, funded by DANIDA-Denmark to provide mobile legal aid for ethnic minorities in Hoa Binh, Son La, Dien Bien, Lai Chau and Lao Provinces. The Center has organized 2,096 mobile legal aid campaign for 94,332 locals in different villages, approximately 500 legal training courses for our collaborators and beyond. In 2015 - 2018, the Center carried out a legal consultancy project on cooperative contracts for local people and businesses, including legal consultancy on labor contracts, employment, insurance for employees in companies and factories in Lao Cai, Lai Chau and Son La provinces. - In cooperation with the Center for Women and Development, the Center implemented community-based mobile legal consultancy projects funded by VUSTA and UNICEF. In particular, the UNICEF-funded project, Forum Lawyers and Children, implemented in 5 provinces across Vietnam, has spread humane valuesto children living on the streets and in nurturing centers, and reformatoryschools.
